title: Sogrape 2016 Herdade do Peso Trinca Bolotas Red (Alentejo)
description: From the new venture from major producer Sogrape, this wine is soft and juicy, with attractive red fruits. Its acidity and gentle tannins are balanced with the refreshing fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

title: St. Julian 2016 Reserve Late Harvest Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Aromas of pollen, wildflower honey and peach are enticing on the nose. This off-dry wine is ripe yet balanced, with flavors of orange, peach and juicy mango. The ripe melon finish is charming and clean.

title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2015 Elè Primitivo (Puglia)
description: There's an intriguing levity to the nose of this this wine in its pressed violet, mint and wild strawberry aromas. Medium in weight, with solid tannic grip, the palate offers more of the same, yet ends on a chalky, mineral finish.

title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2016 Kimia Fiano (Puglia)
description: Shy aromas of citrus blossom and hay evolve into a round palate of pear juice, grapefruit and more hay tones. Medium acidity counters the weight, giving an overall soft and silken feel to the wine.

title: The Pressing Plant 2014 Kick Out The Jams Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Rock manager turned winemaker Sheri Hood honors some old-school rockers (the band MC5) with this affordable Pinot. Boysenberry and plum fruits come along with stiff earthy tannins. For the modest price it has plenty of flavor and some muscle as well.

title: Watermill 2014 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla, dill, toast and baking spice, along with a light meaty note. The flavors show a luscious, velvety feel, with the oak influence running quite high.

title: Watermill 2014 Dugger Creek Vineyard Nebbiolo (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This variety is unheard of in the appellation. Quite pale in color with an orange tinge, the aromas bring notes of macerated cranberry and cherry, along with a vanilla note that gives the impression of confection. The palate brings lighter-styled fruit flavors, with the oak taking over on the back half. The tannins are quite light for the variety. It's intriguing but doesn't seem varietal.

title: William Heritage 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: Oaky vanilla and sweet spice overpower apricot and lemon aromas on the nose. A rich vanilla tone leads flavors of mango, apricot, and mandarin on the palate. The mouthfeel is soft, with balancing acidity and a clean vanilla and apricot finish.

title: Winter's Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: An austere wine, this does not shy away from flavors of stem, beet root and rhubarb. The fruit touches on strawberry, but does not display the ripe flavors you might anticipate from the listed alcohol. It's high acid, herbal and earthy.

title: Boomtown 2016 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pleasing aromas of almond butter, lemon zest and kiwi lead to papaya, pineapple and other tropical-fruit flavors. It delivers immediate appeal.

title: Bradgate 2015 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Lightly toasted apple, melon and guava form the core of this ripe and fruit-forward wine. It's light in body and style, with clean yet delicate acidity and a brisk close. Drink now.

title: Château L'Argilus du Roi 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: This small, 12-acre estate was created in the 1990s. With plenty of juicy Merlot in the blend, this wine is ripe, lightly wooded and has good fruity balance. The contrast with the Saint-Estèphe structure gives the wine density and will let it age. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Lestage Chevillon 2015  Médoc
description: Ripe, fruity and with a layer of firm tannins, this wine has a good future. Its smoky tannins and black-currant fruits are developing well, giving a full wine, rich and ready to drink from 2022.

title: Château Pontet Barrail 2015  Médoc
description: Ripe with black fruits and balanced tannins, this is fast developing into an attractive wine. Its structure and tannins leave room for the juicy berry fruits and acidity, allowing the wine to be drinkable from 2022.

title: Château Tourteyron 2015  Médoc
description: This soft, juicy wine has ripe black-currant fruits and some smoky tannins. It is warm, generous and likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Conti Zecca 2016 Donna Marzia Primitivo (Puglia)
description: Fresh red- and black-berry aromas are underscored by tilled earth on the nose. The palate is similar in character, boasting a ripe and juicy feel, with medium weight, light tannins and soft acidity. Drink now.

title: Cyan 2014 Valdefinjas Crianza  (Toro)
description: Murky, gamy aromas indicate that 2014's wet, humid conditions affected this wine. In the mouth, this is heavy and tough, with grating tannins. Black-fruit flavors combined with lemony oak are chunky, massive and acidic on the finish. This wine is good but has balance issues.

title: Deetlefs 2015 Chenin Blanc (Breedekloof)
description: Fresh apple, orange and green melon are at the fore of this straightforward yet refreshing and tasty wine. It is light in weight and concentration, offering fruity flavors of apple and pear that finish bright and clean. Drink now.

title: Eagle Eye 2013 Estate Reserve AlphaWolf Vineyard Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is tannic and dusty, a big, dense expression of a formidable grape that leers into smoky, dark and brooding territory. Blackberry and cherry drip from an herbal backdrop of intensity.

title: Erath 2015 Bishop Creek Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A number of wineries draw upon grapes from this excellent site. Here, the flavors are of cranberries and raspberries, and remain tart and rather acidic. The tannins are stiff and leave a slightly bitter aftertaste.

title: Erath 2015 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Solid, at first seeming to be a bit on the chunky side, this thins out in the mouth, offering tart berry fruit. Along with that come some stemmy components and tannins that are just hitting not-quite-ripe flavors. It's a sound, but not distinguished, estate selection.

title: Eternal 2016 Eternal Sunshine Morrison Lane Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Unusual aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, lime zest and white flower are followed by light flower and peach flavors that finish tart. It doesn't all come together.

title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Red berry, toast and underbrush aromas mingle with a whiff of eucalyptus. The tightly wound, austere palate offers sour cherry, espresso and a hint of star anise set against grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish. Drink after 2021.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Gilgal Rosé (Galilee)
description: Deep pink in the glass, this wine has a nose of raspberry and orange zest. It is full on the palate, with flavors of strawberry, tart cherry and Red Delicious apple that culminate in a finish marked by lingering acidity.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A rather neutral nose does not give much away. The palate is in a similarly neutral vein, yet it is clean, fresh and balanced. Drink soon.

title: J & J 2014 Middleton Petty Vineyard Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cherry cough syrup and herb bring a light volatility. The black-cherry and licorice flavors are light and appealing but can't make up the difference.

title: J & J 2015 Summit View Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This vineyard sits high on the ridge crest of the SeVein project in the southern end of the valley. Aromas of herb, green tea and purple fruit are followed by tart, plump fruit flavors backed by tacky-feeling tannins.

title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2016 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Overtly fruity aromas of ripe pear and lemon have an almost tropical element about them. These fruit tones remain abundant on a light, easy body. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A touch of ripe pear appears on the nose. The palate adds lemon freshness to the pear flavor and comes together in a balanced, fruity and dry body. Drink soon.

title: La Selva 2016 Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)
description: Aromas of honeysuckle and peach blossom lead the nose. Made with organically farmed Vermentino grapes, the lively palate offers yellow peach and lemon alongside bright acidity.
